The ocean treasure is one of my favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GybL-KLvCG0T9khN5N_qlQ.text: This review is mainly about service.   We've been to this Benihana's quite a few times since they've opened about a year ago or so. We went the other day, and there was only about 3 tables in the main dining room. When we got to the hostess podium, we told  the hostess that we had a reservation for 12:30pm on Tuesday, 1/9/18. We arrived at 12:35pm, and the hostess seemed like she didn't know what to do. She had to ask her co-worker on how to work the GuestBridge system. Maybe she was still new. When she escorted us to the table, she was going to seat us to a table with no settings. I asked her, "Are you sure this table?" And she she said "yes." I said, "There are no settings though." Hostess seemed hesitant and then there was a server who was standing nearby, and motioned her to direct us over to the table WITH settings.   We got seated and she gave us the menus and returned back to the hostess podium. Our server name was Sally (or so it says on our check). She seemed friendly but I think needs more training. I came to lunch with my parents and we all ordered 3 hot teas. When she came back, she handed my hot tea with her hands on top of the rim (where your mouth would touch). There IS a handle that's attached to the cup. I don't understand why she didn't use the handle, but to put her hands on top of the cup. Then when our salads came, she handed to us in a woobley motion and said "Here you go." She didn't use a tray (which she should have) but it looked so sloppy. She held all three salads in both hands. Awkward.   Our food came out pretty good. No complaints about the Teppan-Yaki Chef. He just needs to smile.   Sally came over to the table and she asked if it was going to be on one check. We barely got our food and she asked us if it's going to be on one check. Umm ok? Sally did come a couple of times to check if we needed any more hot water, etc.   I understand that it was such a slow day! Only 3 tables total. A party of 3  ladies (behind us) was already done and there was a single lady who was nearly done as well.  There was a couple who came in about 20-25 minutes after us, and sat across from us. I understand it was super slow. Sally was just chilling in the back by the sushi bar guys. The manager doesn't seem to care too much either. He was having some cheddar fries or hot fries (in guests view) and just chilling.  Shouldn't the manager not eat on the floor, anyway? It just looked so unprofessional.   There was a vendor person working on something that needed all the employees's attention. Which I guess is fine.   When we finally were ready to pay, we needed change. The bill was $51, and we gave Sally $100. Sally then says "I need to find $9 for you." She gave us back $40 only. She was supposed to give us $49. Who does that--give you half change back? My dad didn't wanna wait any longer, so he just said to keep the $9. She probably didn't think we were going to tip her good. Oh well that's probably the best tip she was going to get all day anyhow.   I don't usually come here as often as much as I used to. I think the staff needs new training on how to serve drinks and utilize the trays. Managers should definitely send people home if it's super dead. It's called Labor control. Or have the staff fold napkins or do something that doesn't require personal conversations. It just doesn't look professional. Guess they just don't give a shit. Hostess needs to be trained or retrained on table numbers and the GuestBridge system.  I wanted to say something to the manager, but I don't think he would care. He was too busy eating his cheddar fries.

1sCg7wgYkeMInzyNXFt-nQ.text: Look. I have never had a positive Benihana experience but per previous posts my daughter loves this place. So I suck it up.  We are 40min into seating and have not even placed an order. Mom always said if you do not have anything good to say ...  First update. manager blamed server . Unbelievable   Second update. Made the whole order chicken fried rice. I wanted vegi  Unbelievable part is that the manager threw his staff under the bus. Seems to be re occurring per staff   Staff is great. Manager not so much   End result two + hour service   I'd say I'd never Benihana again

3K-zYiFGwtCmZq_DieuX6Q.text: Nelson(the chef aka Ice Man) and Ryan (waiter aka Maverick) are the best combo for any Benihana location I have ever been.  Vegas has plenty of options for dining, but if you are in the mood for hibachi style cooking you should give this duo your reservation. Good food, great service and excellent entertainment!

gTqkcbQDLKLOjScnfo4Uuw.text: First time visiting this location, been to a few in Cali. This is more updated modernized location it's very nice! Food is always awesome! took moms for her 66th bday and she loved it! Chef Hans our cook was spectacular! We ordered off the "lunch special" menu I highly recommend the fillet mignon/hibachi shrimp plate kind of smallish portions but it was delicious and will come back again this week! They hooked up moms w a desert ice cream & bday jingle of course along w the pictures souvenir. Overall we enjoyed the experience. Always love me some Benihanas!!!

ryb9IykINYAyVuTv0eJsIQ.text: Had a reservation at 7:45 , we got there at 7:38.. didn't get seated until 8:30 .. the server Christina was okay, she gave attitude when someone in our table asked why it was so hot , she just pointed to the grill and said "the grill is hot there's nothing we can do " but I'm assuming it's because we were in a little room and not out in the open like everyone else therefore ventilation SUCKED .. we were sweating , it was extremely hot and humid . My eyes burned from the smoke while chef was cooking.. the chef was young , short dark fella , you can tell he's starting off recently ( we assumed ) but he did a great job . He is the only one that made my experience worth it , he needs a little more practice however he tried his best and he is HILARIOUS ! Front definitely needs to learn how to handle things better . There's no point in making reservations if you aren't going to honor it . Food wise I only liked the shrimp , steamed rice , onion , and zucchini . The scallops were not the best , calamari wasn't either , and only 2 people ( including me ) in our party of 5 enjoyed their food.. safe to say I will not be back .. but I did give the chef 40$ tip because it seemed like he was the only one who cared . Hostess/server didn't really care much for us . Spent over $200 and at the end we all wished we would have gone somewhere else . Waste of money and time .. we left Benihana's at 10:30 .. so we were there from 7:30-10:30.. Yikes .

X_kUEck9NS8-EpI3uou65A.text: Asides from the fact that Steve Aioki's dad founded Benihana, this ACTUAL location is pretty cool. It's the new establishment of the Benihana chain, but of course, they added more flair by modernizing it, opening up, and just adding nothing but red on red on red. For some reason, red seems to be the thing. Like if it's super red inside, some spontaneous thing happens that wouldn't expect to happen in an establishment, or that maybe there's a secret door that leads to some secret room that holds the answers to all of our worldly questions.   Anyways! We hit up Benihana's for a friend's birthday, because it's her favorite spot (let's call her Tami). Tami's husband, spoke to the waitress and asked for the funniest guy in the restaurant. You're welcome. I've cracked the ultimate teppanyaki code. Usually, in experiences like these you pray that the chef you get is the funniest person in the establishment. It makes or breaks your experience. The whole thing is like playing roulette, but with your chef. So I've cracked the code. We got the funniest guy in that place. His name is Tony. Tony the tiger (That's right! You heard me!). I believe he's off on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. So if you're there, and you want the funny guy. No need to slip a $5. Just ask for Tony. ;)  He'll make you spongebob. He'll make you a minion. He'll even write your name on the grill with egg whites. You are a charmer ,Tony! Yes. You. Are. I know. Total spoiler alert, but you'll thank me later when you're coordinating your party, and you want to validate that your chef is funny to ensure your party is happy.  You know the usual fixings here if you're a regular, but I would highly recommend getting that housemade diabolo sauce. It is literal fire. Your mouth will be feeling ten different shades of hotness, but it is addicting.   Also, ask for extra garlic butter. Why? Because your are an adventurer! You live life on the edge! No cholesterol, high blood pressure, or food coma is going to stop you from getting exactly what you want!

WQaPcYv2xCk1LgtG6IA0Mg.text: My first visit far exceeded expectations! What an experience. Food, service and atmosphere were top notch. Can't wait to go back.

x4WvIYdCZvCmZngfkHGhfw.text: This is our favorite place to go for family dinner. It's easy to access from the strip, or the mall. If driving, park in the Macy's parking garage next to the entrance where the escalators are. Make sure to make a reservation since they are always pretty busy. The food is always great here.

PwrIoydyDMmVUDKjzmjtjA.text: Amazing experience!!!! Loved the modern atmosphere of this Benihana located right on the Las Vegas Strip. We enjoyed warm sake at the patio bar which looks out onto Las Vegas Blvd before dinner. Too Much Tony put on a stellar performance while cooking our meals to perfection.   The manager Sabrina went above and beyond to assure we had a memorable experience. We will definitely be returning to this location time and time again!

WJZr8ddWWGw7018ewFeaZQ.text: This was mine and my wife's first ever visit to Benihana.  I must say it will definately not be my last.  Sabrina, the manager, the hostess and the wait staff were friendly and provided excellent service to my party.  We had "Too Much Tony," as our chief who was absolutely great.  Great personality, great performance, and great food.  I emphasizeyou enough what a great experience we had and how great the food was.

PvKnnNjwQuRmQ4pTywArGQ.text: This was my first time at this location, and it was great! The food and service were both awesome.   One of my personal favorite things about this place is they take Gluten Free very seriously. The chef cleaned the entire cook top and got new utensils before cooking my food. Really appreciated how serious they took my allergy.   Definitely would recommend this spot and I will definitely be back!

hbwVejoS7GQN40kz4iExBw.text: I've always heard good comments about this place. The other day my husband and I tried it. So amazing! I highly recommend. Our chef made our experience awesome. I ordered teriyaki chicken and I loved it. Their fried rice is amazing also.   I would recommend calling and making reservations way before you want to dine.

YwTKkDUKC17cJXCG28MVQQ.text: Well I really can't say that much about Benihana's because i eat here a lot, and it's always the same food that i eat and it's always good so i really can't give a bad or good review about the place. Well i can say is Johnny almost forgot to put the eggs in the fried rice, but that's ok playas mess up sometimes. When i asked for extra garlic butter for my food he gave it to me so i just really can't say anything good or bad about benihana's it's just my favorite hibachi japanese restaurant.

XwBZ0fR4GZncb42lbn0o8g.text: This Benihana is our favorite. The decor is modern and the floor plan is very open. I love the style. We've eaten at this location probably 2-3 times a year since it opened. We went for Valentines Day last week and I was a little underwhelmed by our chef, Carlos. Firstly, let me say his cooking was perfect, so no complaints there at all. He just seemed a little green to me. He didn't have the Benihana flair yet and he's very soft spoken. Hard to hear him over the grill and noise of the restaurant.

8TN6uc3PwhoZaU7Nlq3D2A.text: Called twice to make a reservation. Was told both times it wasn't needed. Just now walked in and were told it's a half hour wait.   Me: "But I called twice to make a reservation and was told it wasn't necessary"  Host: "it's not required, but there's reservations ahead of you"  YEA. THAT'S WHY I TRIED TO MAKE A RESERVATION IN THE FIRST PLACE. SO WE WOULDN'T HAVE TO SIT HERE FOR HALF AN HOUR.   What the heck? Monumentally annoying and pretty unprofessional.

sbTODi6dvoNWQNP_8OOA7A.text: We made a reservation and arrived just a few minutes early. It took a little longer than expected to be seated and then of course several minutes before the chef was out. It was so incredibly hot in the restaurant and being in there so long made me start to feel ill. Our chef was wonderful. The food was delicious. I definitely recommend keeping the time difference in mind if you are from out of town. We had a 8:30 pm reservation, which was really 11:30 pm to us and made it difficult to eat such a heavy meal. With the price, I would just make sure you go hungry and not too tired to eat. It was quite good!

Zp8O4y_WYA21OcnmEDyOCg.text: Good food, poor service.  I had my sunglasses on the table & the waitress heavily set a bowl of rice down on top of them, and she didn't say anything.  When she realized I was bothered by her clumsiness & lack of politeness, she said "sorry" and walked away with an attitude.  The other waiter also serving on us was also in a bad mood. Maybe that's the norm here?  Regardless, I am not a fan of paying hundreds on food and getting poor service.  Do not recommend unless service doesn't mean anything to you. Such a shame because the food was actually really good.

kXRvcU8dRGjoUtQ6-28IOQ.text: If I could give Benihana at the Fashion Show Mall negative stars I would... 1 star is far too generous! We arrived at the overly crowded resturant for our reservation at 6p last night (Saturday 6/28), to a less than stellar greeting by the hostess. .. but hey! Its 2019! Our expectations  for an above-average greeting are low. We were taken to our table where we were seated with 3 people who immediately told the manager that they were in a hurry as they were running late for a Paul McCartney concert. Two questions: 1. Who goes to Benihana in a hurry?! 2. Why on earth would the resturant seat them with people who were not only NOT in a hurry but were specifically there to enjoy the 'experience'? The chef was rushing through everything... a small trick here n there but his agenda was definitely to get that food cooked...served and get us the heck out of there... just as he had been told. Side note: We spent the week prior building the anticipation of my young daughter, her friend and my 81 year old mother... explaining that their socks would literally be knocked right off by the fun and excitement had by all at Benihana! Their socks stayed put all night. Our party of 5 was soooooo disappointed by the rushing and lack of enthusiasm that we then called the manager over and asked why the 'Rushers' were being accommodated and not us?! The manager then asked our chef to slow down and give the full experience. Understandably the chef was confused and a tad agitated... he is being told to hurry up and slow down. He was flustered! Again... whhhhhy seat us at the same table?!?! Soup came, salad came, rice came, veggies came... we asked why our shrimp appetizers were skipped? Oh the 'Rushy Rushersons' at the table have a shellfish allergy!!! So once again THEY are being favored... and we got to have shrimp for dessert...yay! Our drink glasses sat empty for extended periods. I finally received a refill of warm ice tea which completely melted my few remaining ice cubes. I asked for a cup of ice which I finally enjoyed with my shrimp dessert. In the midst of the rushing, my mom's main chicken dish was not brought out from the kitchen nor prepared.  The chef explained that he was so caught up in obliging the  'Rushers' that he had forgotten. I gave my mom half of my chicken and told him not to worry about it. The 'Rushers' left without a word. They didn't leave the chef a tip although he spend his time and energy accommodating THEM. This did not make him happy and his disappointment did not go unnoticed... yay for us! The manager took our forgotten chicken off the bill but we were charged for the chicken I halved to feed my mother. I am not a negative Yelper... I've never taken the time to write a complaint letter to a corporate office...  but I am furious that we paid actual money for that ridiculousness last night. If I can discourage anyone from going to Benihana at the Fashion Show Mall I will! Don't go! You can pay 25.00 for a basic chicken breast and rice ANYWHERE!!! (And actually in my case a half of chicken breast). The resturant is loud and food average... the entertainment value is not there! Go next door to Sugar Factory... it looked so fun there!

AXLTNkfzVhU6wMEBRZ0pBg.text: Food was delicious and the service was even better! Our Chef Johnny's magic tricks were my favorite part. And my steak was made perfectly. I would go again just for Johnny :)

_nzwVVnm4rkBr7bVVN5Yfg.text: The worst experience ever. The chef was disorganized, slow not skilled and his knifes were dull. My wife's meal was served first, then mine was served 15 minutes later.  After I had eaten my steak, the chef finally served the onions.  Oops, but he forgot the mushrooms.  Too late, my steak was cold  It was a 2 hour painful experience.  To make matters worse when we left, our clothes and hair wreaked from the cooking smoke.  We had to put everything in a blastic bag and send them out to be dry cleaned.  I have been to Benihanas several times, but this location was a disapointment.

iGHIwsAeWdga1DBtgatQTQ.text: Waitress was slow. The drink was good, but not 15$ good. And I am a bartender so I don't mean that because it wasn't strong, it actually was. Again... not 15$ good. The cook (Hans) was incredible and very funny. The lunch portions are a good size and a good price but everything else is crazy expensive and the waitress we had this time was not good, I can't even remember her name... it's a tough crowd at Benihana and the girl I was sitting with was giving her a hard because she was pretty unhappy w the service. I felt bad, so I tipped good. But all in all, it's way overpriced for what U get. However, if u are looking for some bomb sushi and happy hour, this is ur spot. Just stay away from the grills. xaoXJqf3BAoXLjQTnsQMmA.text: Honestly, an awful experience (horrible HORRIBLE service but good (expensive) food). First, I made a reservation for 4 people at 7:15 tonight for my boyfriend's birthday to find out they "got confused" and "gave the reservation to someone with a similar name". So we had to wait for about 15 minutes for a reservation I made a week in advance. Then, we waited for 20 minutes for them to tell us that the grill we were sitting at was not working. Then, WE WAITED FOR ANOTHER HOUR FOR THE CHEF TO COME. During this wait, we witnessed our waiter be super rude to a different customer and waited 15 minutes for soup. SOUP. We only got the soup because one of the people at our table complained about the wait. They did not offer forks or anything to us for the salad or in general. The food was good and our chef, Heath, was very kind and a great chef, but our waiter checked on us once and it was after the chef was done cooking. We had to track him down for literally anything (or anyone for that matter) and it just was an awful experience. Don't waste your time here. It's overpriced and if you want cheaper, faster, and just as great quality food go to: Hokkaido and Ohjah. Both amazing places with great waiters, great service, great food, and very much worth it.

Our server had us on every single thing we needed and my needed butt needed a lot with my drinks I couldn't make up my mind but she stayed patient and worked with me both got a tip will return back loved it 5 stars

0XZhe8QZyi_ZDTZwbutQvQ.text: My husband and I were leery to take our 5 kids here for lunch. The range in age from 12 to 4 years old and having never had Hibachi before, we weren't sure how well they would do. This was the best 'risk' we took in Vegas!  The seats are far enough from the griddle that little hands can't reach (if that's something you're nervous about) and our cook was simply amazing!!  If you are able to sit at one of Johnny's tables, DO IT! Not only was the food amazing, but he was fantastic with our kids! He was entertaining, personable, easy to talk to, funny...it was like having lunch with a new best friend who was instantly family. He even did magic tricks for our kids after they were done eating so my husband and I could peacefully finish our meals. I simply can not praise him enough!  And if Johnny's manager is reading this: I don't know what he is being paid, but that man deserves a raise! Hands down the best service and experience we have ever had, anywhere!   Plus the food was delicious! We ordered the sushi appetizer, Hibachi steak, chicken fried rice, soup, filet mignon, lobster tail, shrimp...all were absolutely delicious!  Also, the portions of the kid's menu were great! Our older kids are often still very hungry when they order off the kid's menu, but they had more than enough to eat here! Even our picky eater  We will absolutely be back and will continue to insist our friends and family do the same. All our future trips to Vegas will include at least one meal at Benihana's to see Johnny!

bldgHKvJDdYg6gA-ZX05aw.text: I give this review not against the restaurant itself, but one of their waitresses, Christina. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to dine in due to an asthma attack that was triggered by the stove. Christina was serving me and two of my friends at a table with another party of 3. As soon as I felt that I was ill and needed medical assistance I kindly asked if she could ring me up for my meal and have it plated to go so my friends could bring it to me after. She asked if "I had to go now" and I did let her know I was sick and needed to see someone. She handed me the bill, which I paid for in full, and I went to the front of the restaurant and waited to be escorted by mall security to the a place where I could get transported to the nearest hospital. As I was waiting, she came up to me and let me know that "I left my braid on the table." I currently have Senegalese twists and one came loose and fell under the table.  I'm struggling to breathe and this is what she approaches me to say? "Not I hope you feel better. Sorry you didn't get to dine with us" nothing. So now I'm extremely annoyed and want to know why she just came up to me in the manner that she did.  It turns out that she was upset that I didn't tip her. I would understand that if she actually served me..she did not. I ordered and paid for a drink I didn't get to touch. She was pressuring my friends to call me and let me know that I didn't tip her which they refused to do. She also went as far as reprinting my receipt and asking one of my friends to forge my signature. I couldn't breathe and all this woman was worried about was a 13 dollar tip. The managers were receptive to my complaint, but I will be calling corporate.   Nothing against Benihanna's once again! They were very attentive and the management made sure I was comfortable while waiting. Just know that Christina feels extremely entitled to her tip. Even if she didn't do anything :)

4xchdSUXpxl8sFtq1gyl-g.text: Came in for lunch. Waitress was very nice Drinks too Food was perfect I never finished my food at any Benihana but did here  After reading the bad reviews  I was very nervous but we can not complain. It's new, very clean. Only 1 con is we had to wait 35 minutes for the cook to start at the table, that's a lil bit long for a lunch service in an almost empty restaurant ( 3 tables were full)  Brendon was our cook, he was very nice , attentive and funny, entertaining . We enjoyed our lunch there. Prices r lil bit higher then in CA but still ok.  Will be back soon

sRHqOgBGPzVrdJPtJ15sBA.text: We came here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner. We made 6pm reservations and got there a little early. The restaurant is set up into almost 2 different dinning experiences. One side is pretty basic dining and the other side is  set up with several chefs tables where you will be entertained by the chef and possibly be sitting with complete strangers. It was only the 2 of us, so after we were seated, the  hostess sat two more parties of 2 people. Each table accommodates 8 guests total. The show is fun, chefs are playing with your food while they cook it, and everyone gets to watch. We ordered the steak and chicken and the shrimp and chicken. Both entrees were part of a 5 course dining, including soup, salad, shrimp appetizer, main course white rice, vegetables and hot tea to finish. You have the option to substitute your rice for fried rice, and I highly recommend it! Best fried rice I've ever had!  At the end of our dining all of the servers gathered around and sang happy birthday in Japanese and then in English. They also offered a small dessert too. The prices are extremely reasonable here and the service team really exceeded our expectations. It is a great way to celebrate a birthday or any occasion.

srqiRkRJwSH1ckCv-bu89Q.text: We are locals and came out for a friend's bday. Something went wrong with our reservation at 9pm. We weren't able to sit till 10 pm. The manager gave us all appetizer cards to apologize for the inconvenience. Our server was Tia. All she did was take our order and then sit down for our whole entire meal. We also weren't offered any drinks they just brought us water which we had finished and sat empty for most the night. We asked for sake bombs and they brought us shot glass that were too tall that didn't even sit in the cups properly. I wish they would have let us know prior, that they don't have the proper glasses to do sake bombs. They forgot to sing my friend happy birthday. All the servers had a bad stinky stuck up attitude and all 14 of my friends will never be back ever again. The chefs were funny, friendly and entertaining the only saving grace of the whole restaurant. Osaka is much better! With much better service don't waste your time coming here.

Gy0zLrSpN6vQzQcT0YlFcw.text: Really disappointed. It was our anniversary dinner , I even noted that when doing the reservation online. Got there a few minuets early and had to wait and that's fine. Got seated in the back corner and that's fine. Usually either the server and or chef ask about special occasions. The chef asked a group of ladies and it was one of their birthday. When it came to us it was , where you from ? Start to answer him and he just rudely moves onto the next group. He was also kinda short with them , then going back to the girls. The overall show was meh , didn't care for the fact that food was flying from the grill onto the table. My wife got the Chateaubriand and said she wanted it rare. The guy almost over cooked it. My wife was not happy. Then at the end they ask again about special occasions , only made sure that the girls were celebrating a birthday and the server says well you get a free ice cream , my wife says it should say it's our anniversary. I'll make sure to get a ice cream also. A group of employees sang a "celebration song" , gave us our bills and collected them. All the years been going to the one near home , people celebrating an occasion, they always take a photo of you to commentate it. Did that happen ?? NOPE !!! That was the nail in the coffin for us going back again.  I guess my wife and I are spoiled with the level of service we get at the one near home. 2 stars for the food at least tasting good , what we ate of it. We never  take a to go container and my wife I did this time.

LisQzFKc1HX17TXSpqyZOg.text: Finally a new location!! I know it's been a year already, I'm just late to the party. Came with a big party to celebrate mine and my mother's 4 year kidney transplant anniversary :) Beautiful interior and amazing service. They even kept the cake we brought cold in their back fridge! The menu looks to have expanded with plenty of new appetizer options and added sushi rolls. Much smaller than the location at the west gate, but the modern touch and more convenient location makes up for it. There is valet parking very close for the restaurants outside the Fashion Show and you can even text them when you're done with dinner and they'll have your car ready! There's no fancy koi pond or waterfall like the old Benihana's, but it was still a wonderful experience!

ucLzWxODfaGG99Qw6LvKiA.text: Food: No other restaurant can compete or compare with Benihana's fried rice with garlic butter. It is the best, and what keeps me going to this restaurant.    Customer Service: Unfortunately, the customer service experience is consistently one of the worst experiences I've had at a restaurant. I frequent this restaurant often and the customer service is awful. As an example, my cousin specifically informed the server how she wanted the chef to prepare her steak, medium rare. She also mentioned that she didn't want sauce on her sushi rolls if it has a mayo base due to food allergies.   Unfortunately, the server brought her the steak well done that was supposed to be cooked medium rare, and the sushi rolls had mayo sauce that she informed the server ahead of time, not to add it. The server seemed annoyed and had an attitude about it.   Once we received her meal that she ordered 20 minutes later after originally ordering it the first time, I was done with my meal and had to wait for her to eat hers. We also noticed the chef recycled the sushi rolls by scraping off the mayo sauce. We were in shocked that he did that, even though we informed the server twice of her allergies which still could have caused an allergic reaction. We spoke with the Manager about it and she apologized for the inconvenience.   Again, the food is great! However, the customer service is lacking big time!! Please keep in mind that was only one example of many times that I have experienced bad customer service at this specific location.

-QpsZ0lS0H8ygRcetI9yxA.text: Chef kept on flirting with a group of women who were enjoying their birthday, however did not care that my wife and 3-year old were there and could have had some self-respect. Chef also forgot the chicken portion of my meal and forgot the shrimp of another woman's meal. Server did not make us feel welcome, more like we were bothering her for being there. I was also there to celebrate my wife's birthday and usually the server asks if we were there for a special reason, but she did not, so I had to mention it. After our meal, she asks the other lady what kind of ice cream flavor would she like for her bday and didn't ask my wife and I had to again tell her that it was my wife's bday! We love Benihana and always eat there for special occasions, first time trying Benihana's in Vegas... total let down.

QhB87JiqK0qQQ6r7znbNPQ.text: Great time at Benihana's today. My husband and I are on vacation and decided to keep it simple. I was running a few minutes behind and they were very accommodating. We had the table all to our selves (I know I am pretty lucky(;) with the greatest cook Johnny Aka Magic J.  He's not your average. Made us laugh the whole time and even did magic tricks after.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He made my special request &#34;chicharron&#34; with love
Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Johnny aka Magic J

nbFjQ5DvdLX7mAbXZVWHVw.text: So, Benihana has a lot of hype around it. I was in town with a group and this was a wonderful spot for a group.   The service was good, the chef was kinder than the server who worked hard, but wasn't "friendly". He was full of all of the details such as the sauces available, the salad dressing, the rice and the order he would be taking orders. It was necessary to pay attention.   We were there for their dinner service. I believe we paid for their name more than anything. I had the filet and scallop dish affectionately called  Land N' Sea. It was $45 which is fine, but the fried rice was an additional $5 which I thought was odd. If you don't make that selection you get the white rice. The meal included soup and salad. It should have included ice cream, but that never came to the table.   My steak was perfect, cooked just as I requested and the scallops were good too. That garlic butter is a winner. There was a hefty serving, plenty for me to take home and have lunch the next day.   I was visiting and there is no Benihana in my city so when I say I wouldn't go back, that's pretty accurate...but mostly because I wouldn't go out of my way for Benihana.

1_CQYlwhjrgnxoFHditCdQ.text: I've always been a fan of the Benihana chain of restaurant so my friend and I decided to come here for lunch to celebrate my birthday. Nothing too fancy or too crazy. When we arrived, I confirmed the reservation which they had a problem finding at first but come to find out the hostess was new and just didn't know.. not her fault.. Anyways, we started off at the bar because it was happy hour and well who doesn't want one of the huge Benihana punch bowls at Noon? It's Las Vegas and 5 o'clock somewhere right? The bartender was super sweet and made our drinks perfect.   After grabbing the drinks we headed over to the table where there was only one other family. The chef was cool and did a great job with performing all the tricks and singing. Food was good as well although I felt like I got shorted on the amount of scallops that I normally get but whatever.. Overall I would say it was a good experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benihana Punch Bowl
Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HoLtouo1FTT9aQ6yWDKPJw.text: Went to this Benihana during my Bachlorette Party weekend and we had so much fun! Our cook Adam was so awesome! Funny, attentive, and super awesome. The food was great and just such a great experience. We go to Benihana back in California monthly so to come and have a totally different experience with new tricks and an awesome cook was a great feeling!! He even took a selfie with us :)

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Went to this Benihana during my Bachlorette Party weekend and we had so much fun! Our cook Adam was so awesome! Funny, attentive, and super

hcA_TQn4W0T4c3yhRHUGLg.text: Wow wow wow! Just ate here and I had excellent service that I needed to write this review! My server Lin was so sweet and fast paced it made my visit awesome! Thank you so much !!! Will be back (:

Qiubx0mu3pmE__poPl_FQQ.text: If you've been to any Benihana's, you pretty much know what to expect and it's going to be pretty much the same whichever location you go to. And you either love it or it's really just not your thing.   I love a good hibachi grill and I've been to some really high-end ones in Asia. This is not that, but it's good fun and the food is plentiful and tasty. Plus, I'm a sucker for a good onion volcano and some entertainment while dining.   The only thing I don't like is smelling like the food when you leave, but there's nothing much you can do about that. All in all it is a fun way to spend an evening dining with friends. I always find Benihana is better with a large group.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of meat
Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster
Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg Tricks

4uGT0hIE2GBv0Z-IFt2Fxg.text: I've come into this Benihana on several different occasions and one thing I will say is, the guy that's usually there cooking on my lunch hour makes the food the best!!! Literally LOVE my food when he cooks it. There's no need for me to add sauce to my rice or any season to my food. It's PERFECTION!! Service is usually great too but when I came in recently I had to ask my server for spicy teriyaki 3 times and still didn't get it. I also wasn't satisfied with my food because the regular cook wasn't there. (Not to say the food was terrible). Also, the salads are tasty but I don't like how it comes in a cold bowl with dressing on top and you can obviously see that it was pre made sitting in the fridge, it's not appealing. I hold Benihana to a higher standard than that.  When I went into the bathroom a host was just starting her shift and was getting changed in the big stall. I don't think she used the restroom BUT she didn't wash her hands and it didn't sit right with me at all. Once you touch anything in the bathroom especially a public one, you must wash your hands -Whether you're a server or not.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pre-made salad
Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak was tender but bland. You can visibly see that the rice needs more soy sauce.

SyBKbvl0UeONz9rCJD5IuQ.text: Came here my first time because my husband had a birthday coupon. It brought us in but everything we had was fantastic. I ordered the steak and lobster everything was cooked to perfection. My husband ordered the chicken and steak and noodles and everything was very good there as well. the waitress Monica was excellent very attentive and kind nice personality. Our cook Kyle was awesome as well.

bioasYvSsHizSBwl0bykrw.text: Awful. Our waitress was so rude and completely uninterested that we were there. She seemed miserable and decided to make sure everyone else felt miserable too. Soup came out warm-ish. Paying $150 for a dinner for 2 should at least come with a smile from your server. Fake it if you have to, but don't bring us down just because you don't like your job. Didn't need it, but weren't offered the hot green tea or the ice cream at the end. Probably would have declined it, but at least give me the option since I'm paying for it. Also, zero ventilation in this place. Hole in the wall Korean bbq places in LA do a better job controlling the smoke. We couldn't leave fast enough. Wish I read previous reviews before we went because the poor service seems to be a common theme here. Ugh.

t0vIgcWUYnZUTjLbYXTt6Q.text: In one word: Familiar. From various birthdays to elementary school hangout, I'm not sure if I grew up with Benihana or they grew up with me. Maybe I grew up because the many hasn't changed.   I love the chateaubrand with all the knickknacks they come with it, my all time love ...garlic butter   The salad dressing is yummy, lettuce is always crisp. The steak is delish and the friends rice is beyond words.   Favorite part about the chef's performance is the mishaps...just wait for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso Soup

ahNUA9SwzBC5t0AcX3U1tA.text: Ryan the chef Cooking the food was excellent ! even did some magic tricks and no joke I can't figure out how he put those extra eggs under the metal bowl ! The food was absolutely magnificent &  cooked to perfection.  I was sitting with some French people,  just a wonderful experience - fillet was absolutely tender and perfect - I adore the ginger salad that comes with the  dinner. What a kickback fun meal :))

lpSUYhj32rXB_TT1XKMBZw.text: I had excellent experience last year when we had dinner as my birthday at the Benihana on the strip . I have been to the other locations but not in Vegas . I love Benihana services . We went back to celebrate my birthday again this year . The food was ok to me last night maybe because of server . Our waitress wasn't happy to serve us at the beginning. We made the reservation at 8:15pm, we were there earlier than expected. Our host was friendly and took us to the table, we joined with the other groups . Our server is an Asian lady. I got Benihana trio which I did not get my hot tea beside my ice cream . My mom and dad shared Ocean Treasure one. Our chef , Adam , is funny and friendly. Our server brought the check and told me the bill doesn't include service charge. In the mean way, I got it and I can read my bill so you don't need to tell me that. I decided to tell her the truth after she said that to me. And thank you for your service.

9-dSSSd4cY13SDLaXZneSQ.text: I had a good decent amount quality of food here, it was the service and the bathroom is what I didn't like. First it was the chef not cooking the appetizer until the end once we had finished eating everything else, then the waitress had to keep going back and fort to get the right check for us, and lastly, the bathroom sink and toilets were dirty and the sink was clogged! There were no toilet bowl tissue covers available and i just couldn't bare to use their restroom. For the location to be on the strip, I expected a better service and cleaner restaurant.

pipa4STGid-22u-a2MvLXw.text: I've frequented Benihana at the older location (Westgate Hotel) and my friend decided she wanted to celebrate her birthday at this location. Once we were seated, everything went downhill, the teppanyaki chef was obviously new which is no problem... however he cracked the egg and got shells all in the rice and continued to serve it to our group. He mistakenly gave my friends selection to another patron as well. Lastly, this location evidently decreased the portion sizes but still continue to charge 30+ for a meal which is ridiculous.... oh you also have to pay for extra sauces aside from soy.....which I've never heard of. Doubt I'll be back, this location is more so catered to tourists who just want the experience!

5vpXxtD4wyL7jc4lnirmTw.text: We are definitely not new to Benihana's restaurants, however this experience tops every experience before it!  Our chef was Tony Too Much and he was amazing!!!  Our food was cooked to perfection, conversation was wonderful and he was SO good with our children. We have another trip for Vegas planned and we are making another reservation and requestion Tony for our chef again!

QBvyMAiDOcW7mia_3e_3VQ.text: Last Wednesday (8/29) was our family's fifth time dining at Benihana - Las Vegas Strip.  When we are back in town, we are back at Benihana.  We have truly enjoyed our dinner thanks to Chef Tony.  We have read rave reviews on Chef Tony so we have decided to request him and he didn't disappoint.  He was truly a master Benihana chef with his great skills.  He made everyone laugh and be comfortable.  Our Hibachi Salmon with Avocado tartar sauce, Teriyaki Chicken and Hibachi scallops were all cooked to perfection.  The 5-course meal really satisfied our hunger.  Thank you also to our server, Jasmine who was very attentive to our needs the whole night.

-hwcJmrl2eBQ4g5RA3yxqQ.text: Had one of the best experiences. I highly recommend the cook Zack. He made the experience worth the trip. He is funny, a good time and keeps the laughs coming. The food was great.

Dh4JWSwP__F_u-QjD1oSgQ.text: I went with a party of 17. Everything was great . Our chef was awesome ! He was great. Made me laugh throughout the whole dinner .   We had a few incidents when server and chef dropped a teacup and a glass of water , but other than that. I loved it !   I started off with shrimp tempura, Had the colossal shrimp and filet mignon. Everything was Delish and I wasn't skimped on the food portion ! I was very full at the end.   We also tried  the fish punch bowl drink. Very Delish .  Will definitely come back to try out the rest of the menu .   They also sang happy birthday to me . So awesome. I was totally embarrassed. Lol .   I definitely recommend this place ! Such a fun time . Such great food and service !

-tEpAtiQ9OktD11L_mEcEA.text: Not the place that it used to be, no more Asian Cooks just a bunch of kids that used to work at McDonald's that were trained to twirl an egg on a spatula. Waiter brought the check and set it right in front of us before we were even finished with our food. We had to ask for the desert that came with our meal. This used to be one of the premier restaurants to go for Taipei style food, not anymore. We will not be back.

WPC4oyjWT027-7ofFRDzwg.text: Good but not as good as I use to...it to be..., the fry onions in the miso soup is very important..and it was barely any. No salad, why because I ordered sashimi for apprentice? Over all good but a bit over priced.

ma2XVzRhZj2F07Gv6gZZJQ.text: Very clean place with friendly service. Celebrated our birthday and they gave us a picture and ice cream. I ordered the scallops they were delicious.   I will choose steak and lobster the next time. My friend had that and it looked amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday pic

QsT3AcbKSzzY6auu_IHveA.text: Say at the bar for Happy Hour yesterday and the food and drinks were amazing! The only thing better was the excellent service we received from our bartender

rFv7vZltGh4INPfgkiT__g.text: Thomas was amazing !!! Please go and ask to sit in his section and have Omar cook for you!!! Highly recommend !!!! We will def return

NZAMP_CHJeLv1f9zHeD0tg.text: Great Happy Hour on the strip! $7 mojitos with three flavors to choose from; original, exotic, and coconut. Tried all three and they were all good. The exotic was a little bit too sweet for me to enjoy the entire thing but regardless it was good. $6 beers too. You can sit at the bar and people watch. Great place to stop and wait for your party to be done shopping at the mall. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour mojito. $7 three flavors to choose from!

QEp6VcMnp1YNALTxu5nFnA.text: Five Stars for the Management, manager TJ, the Japanese "origami lady" waitress by the lounge and for the decor of the restaurant.  I came here to celebrate my birthday (With my bday coupon!) a few days ago and was not impressed by the food HOWEVER TJ and the waitress was really kind.  It was only Day 2 of their Grand Opening and they are still working out the systems, so I understand.  We had a great time, sat by the bar. We ordered 2 full entrees but I wish they had more of the San Francisco selection.  The entire Beni crew sang Happy Birthday to me! Posted on Yelp.  Good LUCK and all the Best to this Beni location!!  cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We sat @ the lounge. Didnt want to watch the usual beni show since i&#39;ve seen it 1000000 times.

Zh-9DuyX--Gipsh8VOHy9A.text: Great place but our chef was weak compared to the competition across the room. Good thing he was a great cook just need to brush up on the entertaining skills..

uYiHioNoBtFDGpziqpPv7Q.text: This was a great Benihana because of our waiter Sean. He was super nice and made lunch a great experience for us.

fir29hcrN30UM0o4CeuUNQ.text: Service was terrible; food was cold. Benihana's is one of my favorite restaurants, but this location leaves lots to be desired. Won't be back.

gP1YiJ-66d6bxszKnv6Xgg.text: This place was amazing! Food was great! First time here husband and I enjoyed the great food and entertainment from the chef will be coming back whenever we are in Vegas

uYfVcK92pNHYgpjfPMphTw.text: Gawd damn it I love Benihana. Love the food, love watching people cook & love sitting with strangers. They send you a BOGO entree every year for your birthday if you sign up to receive it. Their Englewood, Co location needs a serious update & scrub down though  that's the reason for the 3 stars.

yRri4MaRAUsm4CuARis2fQ.text: Very nice ambiance. Waiter was a little extra on the small talk but maybe a tourist would appreciate it more.  We did the 5 course. We ate Shrimp tempura and Karaage for the appetizers. The Sambal Honey sauce was poppin - comes with Karaage - dip them. So good! Soup and Salad was soup and salad- filler food. The shrimp hibachi,  scallops & lobster hibachi, vegetables   and hibachi chicken rice was POW!  POW!

Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Hibachi

16lZHYJsTOUzGx12TB2NEQ.text: We celebrated our 12 year wedding anniversary dinner enjoying the entertainment and indulging in the meat & seafood delicacies at Benihanas newest location on the strip.   We were fortunate enough to reserve a private room that really made the experience much more intimate and special. Our server and hibachi cook were really on-point with service, being attentive making sure drinks were refilled and plates cleared out of the way as well as our hibachi chef's showmanship--always love the onion fire volcano. Not only were we entertained with the  food preparation but it was also delicious. My Hubby ordered potstickers while I enjoyed the Chili Ponzue YellowTail appetizer. Thereafter we were served soup & salad prior to our main entrees: steak & chicken for my Hubby and lobster, scallops and shrimp (Ocean Treasure) for me along with chicken fried rice. The food was excellent!!   Our server, who had a wonderful bubbly personality, also took our picture to commemorate the evening.   Although we had a great time experiencing the hibachi grill service, after looking at their extensive menu we'll certainly be venturing back to try out their other menu items like the Seafood Diablo.

HJA2ouI4CPpPjEEoVauOnw.text: Went there Saturday night with a group of 18 people. They gave us tables next to each other, the food was great, and our chef was amusing and fun. This was a great experience and good value for your money. A great evening. Will tell my friends and cannot wait to come again!

rcHWc_wZW0OX_ol5DwOC0Q.text: Just open 3 weeks, they have their act together!   Brie presented a (from Torrance store) first great impression at the bar. Bubbly personality and welcoming to her "house"! Kui, our table host, created a very calming, friendly and attentive atmosphere. Well, then there was Chef Ryan.......he became our new BFF! Ryan capped off a birthday celebration with festive and humorous presentation!  Already planning our return.

KRaNostnIGFjxpz3lVgyew.text: We were glad to find a familiar place for teppanyaki on the Strip.  It was loud, took a long time to get served.  If the food was good, I can live with it but the food was the worst we ever had.  Everything was drenched with soy sauce.   I am not kidding.  Everything, I mean everything was brown.  No one in the table, 3 groups that doesn't know each other, complained.  I think this Benihana is ran like the factory.  This is not a typical Benihana.

jOzU2638wMaoJVt42SvWBQ.text: Decided to try out the new location for my girlfriend's birthday, assuming they had settled in by now, boy was I wrong. I ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir and the server brought out an ice bucket and put it on ice, which confused me, I thought perhaps their wine was a little warm so that's why, until the server came back and said the bartender informed him that you're not supposed to ice red wine...duh?  Then I ordered the Benihana Delight (chicken and shrimp) for my gf and the server asked how I would like it cooked...lol what?    Our chef came out and started preparing our food with so many slip ups and mistakes that it was hard to ignore. I've had a hibachi chef before who was barely 18 and he made less mistakes. As I looked around the room I noticed the other chefs were much more skilled so clearly we just got the short end of the stick.     The food was definitely the saving grace, everything was delicious, from the chicken fried rice to the scallops. However, my filet mignon was a little undercooked and bland.     I definitely wish we would've gone to the Westgate location instead, it's much nicer and bigger, with a more seasoned staff.

30VFsU_IHkF3PhWID5dExw.text: Locating this place was a bit difficult because their sign was unnoticeable. The bartender was too slow. We also ended up waiting for an hour before we even got our soup. Everyone was pretty hungry and cranky having to wait so long to eat. Our chef Tony was great. He was funny and made a bad experience bearable. Our server was pretty terrible. He messed up our orders more than once, was slow, confused & annoyed all of us with his stupidity. Management did try to accommodate and in the end the food was good but I doubt I would want to return

uFwN-VnZ13ZVoSlUMECA_g.text: One of the best Benihana locations I've tried. Chef Eric was great with the show and food were perfect. Three stars because Jana, the server wasn't that friendly and her service seemed more fitting for Olive Garden.

2ieo2Z5D3H7f34Jo5YRFsw.text: Clean & newer modeled for a Benihana. Delicious food. Big portions. Terrible service at this location. Took over 30 minutes for the waitress to take our order.

_OJPK2WXfG7BGriS4K5Txw.text: Daniel was such a joy, he was so funny and made the experience so nice! Not to mention the food was delicious! Thanks for making my birthday a memorable one :)

aCgjhAwpX2prLdHp-oEDlQ.text: Several months late but wanted to do review before I visit again in April 2017. I reserved 16 persons for my 50th birthday dinner Sept 21, 2016. We arrived on time and still had to wait for awhile which was ok with us. Tried to order a mai tai from bar but bartender was too busy making drinks for servers. Why not have a 2nd bartender management?? After waiting 15 minutes for service a manager helped me and made the worst tasting drink that was NOT a mai tai as he stated!! We finally got seated and one of my guest had to leave, she was not feeling well. We all were seated when some single female stranger came to sit with our group which was awkward. I had to tell her it was kind of weird for her to join our private group when she had other options to sit at other tables with smaller groups. The male manager told me that was too bad she was told to sit with us, I told him it was awkward and felt like walking out with our group but we were all hungry. The lady moved to another table after that. Manager was young and very rude and unprofessional. Place was pretty new and the service reflected that. We had a female cook and an African American male cook which was a first for me at any Benihana. No complaints just thought that was cool! We could tell they were both brand new in training because their skills were bad and service was slow and totally unorganized. We dealt with it and stuck to beers as all the mix drinks were messed up. Because this place was new I am willing to try it out again. We usually go to the other Benihana at Westgate in Las Vegas where they are old school and very much more professional.

iLi12kiNTxY-xvD5MTL9BA.text: Absolutely wonderful experience with my 3 kids. Our chef, Tony, was so phenomenal that my kids asked to talk to the manager. He had all the usual tricks plus pop culture references, an amazing sense of humor and some great dance moves. Request him if you go with kids, or without!

_oqv83PCB9iN5ds5JEnaUg.text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SEEVICE. I've been here to this location many times now. The waiters are very rude and unperfessional with very bad attitutes. I love the food but the employees need a lot of training.

upxmuIF4Oz891nKIAUvrpA.text: Great place and location there lunch here is amazing!!!!  And since the first time I've had New waiter and is very polite and the cooks are so good!

e3umP1mHCUAbfAoqTmDRQg.text: Celebrated my 43rd Birthday there on 9/29/16 only to wind up with food poisoning!!! Yes food poisoning called restaurant to advise manager and he said would call his DM and call me back still waiting on a call back!!! #becareful # customer service definitely not a priority

55uYrgw8rlPBNrJ2tfS5dw.text: I have been going this restaurant for years at there main location. I decided to try something new so we went to this location at the fashion show mall and it was the most horrible experience for be a Benihana's. I am a local and I would never recommend this location to anyone. My food was over cooked and it took server forever to bring my drinks. I paid $160 for a meal and was so not worth it.

rV1dWovrWTJE4C38HDTVPg.text: Went here on opening night and the food was incredible!! I have food allergies, and the chef was so accommodating. Everyone is very kind, and overall, I had excellent service.

329I3XCQ0ueqFCaW8xR_TQ.text: We went here for our 39th wedding anniversary dinner, a nostalgia visit since we celebrated our first anniversary dinner in 1978 in the Benihana in Washington D.C. We had a relatively inexperienced chef cooking for us, and even though the food turned out O.K., for the price it was disappointing. She managed to drop a lobster on the floor before cooking it, so had to ask someone to bring her another one. You really pay for the show here, and even though our chef was smiling and cheerful, she didn't quite have the knife work and "flash" down pat to perform as well as a few of the other chefs at surrounding tables. They recognized our special occasion, and tried really hard, but unless you have never been to this type of restaurant before, save some money and have either a good Japanese, Chinese or Thai meal elsewhere, where it is all about the food, and not dependent on the skills, experience, or temperament of your chef to make your experience special (or not).

9uJCkE62XiGu4zZJQJ0bKg.text: Take my advice...ask for Tony to be your chef! He's the best at what he does. All the years I have been going to Bennihanas, I have never had a chef as great as him! See you next time Tony! "Heyyy she from the bay" lol Hilarious!

5k9YvicsjMG9_mvo7PD6XA.text: The service at this new Benihana was fairly good. The place is very small, though, and it was hard for the staff to maneuver. At times I had to move my chair for them to get by.The two chefs, the one at our table an the table next to us, were pretty much butt to butt. They need to expand the place a bit if possible. The food was not bad. I have a gripe about them giving us rice in the beginning and then it getting very cold by the time everything is cooked. It's not just this Benihana's, but I noticed they do this at other teppenyaki places. Why can't they just wait until everything is cooked and then just bring the rice? Rice cools off so fast, and white rice is just not enjoyable to eat by itself. Anwyay, it wasn't bad and our server was nice. The meat was tender, and the chef at our table told us how to cook it so it's tender. I tried it at home, but, of course, I couldn't do this at home, and my meat still came out kind of dry.

bLeIdz1rnJUAx4ryeeHIag.text: Loved this location compared to Westgate. Communication was great & staff very friendly, quick attending. Food amazing as always ! Our chef was Tony! Such a funny guy will request him again, only negative, did an egg trick & it cracked on my boyfriends new shoe  lol it's clean now though.

PZzBAnWg1CHNcwWFUSs4GA.text: You deserve worse than 0 (cero) stars....it is 10:06 pm and according to your own door sign you close at 11:00PM yet to our surprise tepanyaki tables close at 9:30?..quite literal False advertising and a lack of respect to walking customers ....not returning

d-Ean31NeCCqIvZKGZHp2g.text: What happen to the service here? Our group wasn't greeted right away and the servers seemed to not be there. We use to love this location. Maybe we went in on a bad night but some of the staff need to be retrained on hospitality because they seem really disinterested in anything we were inquiring about.  The quality of the food was still the same that was the only plus part about our dining experience.

FPcGr5RlX9RJve6_FR9i2A.text: It's descent for food and a show..its nothing like it used to be, but it's common place to cut corners on quality in this economy

blUv_2l4Wi1R3G-GDt9PWA.text: Our cook Daniel was the best. Very funny and outgoing. Service was really good. The mixed drinks suck here. Nothing special but costly. Stick to the beer. The food was decent. Very small portions. I got the oceans treasure. Not alot of food. I have gone to several other exact type food locations near where I live and food was way better and way bigger portions. For Vegas and the cost and the competition. Up the portions.

UC6-w3fx2HLYi0hWlQ0KfA.text: Went for a friends 21st... was sat late, had rude staff the entire time besides the chefs themselves, didn't get dessert after ordering 6 course meals which included desserts, and after talking to the GM he was completely uninterested in making up for the extremely unpleasant night. Will never fo here again. Would've made up if the food was even 1/2 as decent as the prices they sell it for.

vy9UpxriAR4LjdvbORogDA.text: Yesterday my family & I (party of 9) visited Benihana for the very FIRST time! We were celebrating newlyweds and a birthday so it was EXTRA special. Let me just say we were enlightened! Daniel, our chef was super friendly and charismatic not to mention his presentation and preparation of the food was cherry on top! I'm so glad we decided to come to this location. We all left with full stomachs and smiles on our faces! Thank you Daniel!

dN_hIVCIR7xWTjssVG23rg.text: Our large party celebrated a birthday dinner here in mid August. We were surprised to learn they had only been opened for a few days because the service was spot on and the food was delicious. From the moment we entered until the moment we left, the staff made us feel welcomed. Our 4 year old grand daughter was eating with us and because of the size of our party, we had two chefs on the Teppanaki table. Both chefs had a great personality and really " played" to our grandaughter with many of the traditional clever cooking tricks and some new ones we hadn't seen before. This was a fun night for our whole family.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benihanas was the perfect place for our whole family to celebrate.

iKQFu4sf0K_FPwP99TdQXA.text: Daniel was our cook. Amazingly entertaining. He made our visit here fun. Will defiantly ask for him the next time we come back.

J8ND6H4zVChoe6zO_w-DlA.text: AMAZING!! The waiter and chef were so patient with my EXTREMELY strict diet! No soy, dairy, or gluten and they handled it amazing. They helped me make choices and cooked my food first before he slathered everything with butter. My food was cooked to perfection and in line with my dietary restrictions. Carlos was so nice and patient while cooking for me and still had personality! I really appreciate the personal attention from waiter and chef and our whole family had a delicious meal!  Would definitely recommend and come back!

HNZ18ArcyJbgw_w2ADtw9Q.text: Set a reservation for my BIRTHDAY dinner for 9:45pm, arrived at 9:58 due to Uber complications. The hostess seated us in the waiting area, at 10:05 she returned and said she is unable to serve us because we were late. Keep in mind this was AFTER she told us she was getting our table ready. Long story short I am left hungry on my birthday night and will NEVER return to a Benihana restaurant.

Y83HVv8GOhVuj0ufK0rQsw.text: The slowest service of all time. Wanted to enjoy our meal but the service was so bad we couldn't. Wow Benihana, what happened to you?

9LR-AW6kStg7Hv6Lc9I2bA.text: Our chef tonight Daniel was hands down AMAZING! He made jokes and got us laughing all the way through dinner. We had a vegetarian, and we had allergies to sea food. He went above and beyond to accommodate both of these things. If you go to this location ask for DANIEL. He has been moved around from one Benihana to another and it's because he's an AMAZING chef!!

N5Wz5DE3Ecj408CxOrqbzQ.text: Great food and excellent service! Our chef, Charlie made an extra effort to make sure we were all entertained and satisfied. I have been to several different Benihannas and she made this experience stand out from the others. The server, Jana was also very helpful and attended us regularly. I would definitely recommend to friends and family!

asxXVRNYU3bC8gZ8ds8Sfg.text: Caleb is an excellent chef and although the AC was broken he still made our time fun and enjoyable. We will definitely be back to see him!!

ppKFUlayQ4nArATvcS2x0w.text: Arlan is the best chef ever . We loved out experience . He was super friendly , we enjoyed our dining experience . I would highly recommend him to everyone that comes here . He was nice and i would come back Just to see him .

N2SvRafI7RrRnx5i6szNew.text: Very bad experience ! Yes I can in and we didn't have a reservation but they gave me a 20 mins min... we waiting a hour and a half to be seated ! Then half of our meals came out some of my family members ate and some didn't then we still have to wait another 30 mins for the rest of the food to come out! Customer services really sucked ! I have visited other Benihana's never have i been this disappointed !

7qW-Z5YBgVAX_kzL34A-zw.text: What a great experience! I often go to this chain of restaurants in the LA area and thought I had seen some of the best chefs. Well I was blown away by this location. We went for lunch and as soon as we arrived we were greeted by a nice gentleman, we were seated right away. The waitress was on it when it came to getting anything we needed. Our chef was Hans and I must say he was amazing. He was joking around with the kids at the table, was great taking count that one of the table mates was allergic to shrimp and made the best scallops we had tasted. Can't wait to go back!

TrFHSJLx8RbjruFd2xKoDQ.text: Went here for a girl friends bday and Tony was awesome! He made it a great and fun experience. He's such a pro we loved the food and the show. Great cooking Tony!!

4M62QxzIzDdcfZc7El3XfA.text: My first time there the food was delicious Jasmine was great and Tame  i hope i spell his name right i really enjoy my time there

a6LIBCQSm0iExvUfuVQhqw.text: Very slow service took one hour after seated to get chef and place was mostly empty.  Food quality was poor and I ordered most expensive lobster and filet combo!  Chef did zero entertaining such as the fire volcano.  Very disappointing.

mYeEr07Rlzv_kJD5-a7pGA.text: One of the LEAST entertaining dining experience... I could've cooked a better meal in my own kitchen.   Our "chef" was such a rookie...  while making chicken fried rice, he forgot to add eggs and the rice flew everywhere.  Next up was the lobster, oh mine, it was soooo over-cooked and tasted rubbery.  Last up was the steak, again, totally over cooked and over seasoned.  Last but not least, we didn't even get an onion-volcano!   Such a forgetful dining experience!  Don't bother coming here if you are looking for something special.

bcLneQnCUJt7zdum0Lte2Q.text: A joke. We came in and waited at the outside bar, it took 30 minutes for anyone to approach us. It was dead at the bar -- no one insight. Kimmy FINALLY approached us and took our orders, cool. The only thing is she never came back around after that. We told her we had another person showing up. When he showed up, he had an energy drink (the manager "blonde headed lady from Washington took his energy drink in under a minute. Guess what? Never asked him if he needed a drink, food, an appetizer, nothing) just specifically came by to take his drink. okay, cool. That's fine. We ordered food, his food took an hour to get to the bar. Guess what he ordered? Teriyaki wings. Like 5 wings...takes an hour? Horrible. And they're on the LAS VEGAS STRIP?! The blonde headed manager lady with big lips was doing something with the glasses. Nothing important. Even though our food at most (for some people) took 30mins to an hour -- not one service industry professional told us why our food was taking so long, no one apologized for the wait, in an empty BAR. The quickest service we got was the manager taking that energy drink away. I wont return.

5sTWCAtLnnSBb7KzntGTgQ.text: Just came to this location for my second time ever and another great experience I'm so happy I ran into the manager from San Diego open though what a super nice guy talking about the company and you guys are lucky to have Tobin  Alex our server was great.   And the chef was awesome.  The white guy with the beard

5HOL9FEaVYgUjRQqPKFu1g.text: Great experience and great food.  Our chef, Edwin, was awesome!   We made a reservation for dinner and were seated pretty quick!

HNAz0aSEpsQSjgui0A3mjw.text: Greasy oily tuna steak.  Stay away. Terrible.  Unauthentic. Worse than a bad food truck.

flsk0TN-EDnAScNa0GK1lw.text: This is my favorite restaurant however today as I was eating my shrimp I noticed the poop shoot was still on the shrimp yuck.

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_ORqcNfMtOOLvd9RJwvTNQ.text: The service was great. The server was funny and patient with the group. The chef was nice and the food was perfect.  Only problem...we have been waiting for almost 2 hours for our checks. We had a group of 8 people (including myself) celebrating a birthday party. Everything was going extremely well until it was time to pay. We were told we had free drinks due to a coupon and we were charged. They said they would take care of it and we sat for another 20 minutes. Then the checks were still messed up and again we are now still waiting. Been here since 6:30pm and planned to be done by or before 9pm due to the food coming out quickly. So we can move on to our next event planned. Now we are all frustrated and ready to go. Oh and they forgot to sing happy birthday to the birthday girl.  Overall server (Alex) and Chef (Hans) thanks for the great meal and service!

1koCNg-KNxQI2gzfJqc8Ww.text: This was one of the best night for my sister's birthday! Josh was absolutely wonderful with honoring her birthday special. Ryan our waiter was delightful. Hansen our cook was entertaining and very skilled chef. Along with our table mates we all enjoy the experience. THANK YOU!!

m92O-xUQdIHbZvgf3En5qQ.text: Chef Tony was hilarious and went out of his way to make it a memorable experience for everyone at our table. He cooked our meals perfectly and kept making sure we were happy with what we had. Our server was Ryan, extremely nice and attentive. Very accommodating for everyone's requests.  Two of us had birthdays and all staff that sang were smiling and having fun. Definitely my best meal and atmosphere on this trip to visit Vegas.

hYym_AN8j799gyspq_Mp0A.text: First off, this is not my first visit to your establishment. I've visit many in California and have had a memorable experience.  I visited the Las Vegas venue on Saturday nigt 3/23. What an awful and disappointing experience.  Started with a lost 9pm reservation for 6 hungry and tired visitors.   At 830pm i Called to verify our time slot and of course....reservations  not on the books.  Hostess was able to put is on for 915.  Arrived at 905 but the didn't seat us till 25 min later.  By the time the whole table was greeted by our waitress Danielle it was 10pm.    We politely asked her if we can place our whole order due to it being late and we knew thats why people come to visit to enjoy a cooking show and your food. Danielle denied us and told us she was to order drinks and appetizer only.   Ok....  After our long wait of nothing i decided to politely go over to the hostess to request the manager Ruby was the person i spoke with.   But during my conversation with Ruby Danielle noticed that i was having a conversation and right away took offense of my actions and was rude and condescending to me. Roughly Placing my soup and salad as if she was upset.  Never once did Danielle ever say that the kitchen was having issue or why it was taking an hour to get our first course.  Not sure you want  these type of people  representing  your establishment. Miguel the chef provided a ok show. He could see that the whole table was upset.  He did his best.  Not sure if i will return to the one in LV or to recommend your establishment to my friends.   My husband had words with the 2nd manager Josh who is definitely not a person who needs to be part of your establishment. Rude and not respectful to customers that are visiting your establishment.  Hopefully you'll address this issue  soon.  I enjoy Benihana food and the cooking experience.

-dYAOdI9RqzydYCxiubhzw.text: Bomb service! Our chef Kyle was great, cooked us a delicious meal perfectly with a friendly conversation. Made us feel very welcomed with great conversation and impressive show.   We came for lunch on a Friday, for the $16 Lunch duo. Your choice of two items, which comes with soup and vegetable fried rice. I totally recommend the yakisoba and calamari!  On a Friday @ 12 pm it was very slow so we had the whole table for our party of four. Very clean and modern located in Fashion Show mall on the strip side, easy access to the restaurant. The closest parking is at Fashion Show, right underneath the mall.    This place is great for a cheaper lunch meal on the strip, great choices and food with a show.

ChwRdEob3WKHR_km90NkkQ.text: I took my wife and kids here for dinner last night.  The service was impeccable and the food was outstanding.  Our chef, Adam, was personable and entertaining.  I definitely recommend this experience to anyone looking for a night out with their family.

at8GU2JlKpexg-x04WaF9w.text: The best thing about the experience was the food. Everything else fell far short of our expectations. We made a reservation for 4 at 9:00pm to celebrate my spouse's birthday. We were finally seated 20 minutes after 9. The server came over and took our drink orders, and they were served fairly promptly. Then things started going downhill very quickly. To say the service was slow would be the understatement of the century. The table behind us was seated 10 minutes after we were, but their order was taken before ours and they were already finished eating by the time we put one bite of food in our mouths. We didn't even have a chef to cook our meal until 10:30pm (again, for a 9:00pm reservation). The server and manager had no explanation as to why it took so long for us to be served while the other table was taken care of so quickly. With the cook not getting to our table until an hour and a half after our reservation time, you would think the wait staff and management would be constantly checking in on our group, making sure we have full glasses or a free round of drinks. You would be wrong. When he finally did arrive, the cook's presentation of the food was so-so at best. The first trick he performed was dropping an egg on the floor. Luckily the food itself was tasty. Management did give us a discount for the inconvenience, but the whole experience left us with a bad taste in our mouths. Pun intended.   By the time we left, the restaurant was empty. My spouse went to the bathroom as we were leaving. When he came out a minute later, management had locked the doors. He had to unlock the door to let himself out of the store because there was no employee there to do so.   Next time, we will go to the Westgate location. We have always had great service there.

Zly7IjGlfZU3UXA51nan6A.text: Normal prices compared to other locations- except they recently got new management that will not allow guests extra GARLIC BUTTER without paying?? Absolutely insane that you can go in and spend an average of $120 for 2 people without alcohol, and they choose to be stingy about that!? We love coming here either way, the girls up front are never welcoming, BUT the rest of the staff is amazing! I would consider new hostesses from a management standpoint, they're THAT rude at times. Never welcoming, and actually scoffed in my face and told me they can't know how long guests will stay after eating when I let them know my reservation was 40 minutes prior and we were still waiting(And for my husbands surprise bday party too): ..but seriously don't let the ladies be the reason you don't stay! We come here as often as possible, for every reason we can! Expect to spend $30-50 per person and spend about 1.5 hours here for the hibachi seating. All the food is great, and they are very accommodating to our twin toddlers.

swk-busE8cEadElQWlAFwA.text: So we sat at Table 5 and our chef was Aaron , our server was Jasmine ticket #40023. So everything started out well, we received our table in the time we reserved. Our server started us out with water as we placed our drinks/sushi/and food orders. Our sushi came late, like after our soup. And only one of the two rolls came. We had to inquire about the 2nd roll. The second roll came after our chef had began serving the rice and stuff. (We rejected the second roll, it was already time to eat the main meal). There were times we had to ask for our waitress to find out where our regular steam rice was, or for refills, or for another fork. Seemed once the chef came it was a total disregard for the table.   So as we were talking about our service and another table enlightened us to the fact that the chefs don't get none of the tips at the end of the night that you give to the server. You have to tip the chef independently in order for them to receive any tips. In my opinion I think that's total crap, the chefs are the personalities that everybody gets to meet in deal with not the server. That policy should be reversed where all tips go to the chef, if you want to tip the waitress then do so.  Aaron was a great chef and a good personality! We def be back to see HIM

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nfwn8aIQfNTtGkpadeS-iA.text: My husband and I arrived around lunchtime. We didn't want to do the hibachi tables but , instead, order off the regular menu. We were directed to the bar area to dine .  It wasn't my first choice but when I found out they were doing Happy Hour I was happy to oblige! They HH menu is good from 12-6pm Mon - Sat and they also have a special lunch menu. The prices are reasonable . I ordered seaweed salad, a couple of rolls and a side of the hibachi vegetable rice. In True Cecille fashion, I ordered way too much food. But everything I did have was delicious! The rice alone I could eat but in a larger size!  Service was a little delayed as the bartender seemed to be spread way too thin so her manager had to step in to help. I would definitely eat here again.! It's a welcome change from the mall food court (it's located directly outside of mall next to the Sugar Factory).

dyAnQhPJ_b52alRhgDVsXQ.text: Omg!! I go to Benihanas often in Cleveland BUT  Las Vegas in the fashion show mall has Johnny aka Majic J!!! If you go please request him. One word to describe is AMAZING! Whenever I'm here this is my go to!!

Obvu00-YhBmPq-JRL2jLuA.text: We do Hibachi every six months for our birthdays. No matter how many times we see it, the show is always exciting and entertaining. Johnny, though, lemme tell you about Johnny. This man went ABOVE and BEYOND in keeping the routine fresh and exciting. We've all seen "egg roll" but have you ever seen the chef magically produce a SECOND EGG ROLL out of thin air? We all love the onion train, but have you ever seen a chef snatch the fire from the onion and throw it at a coworker? What about scrambled egg art? A full on four trick magic show after the grill is all cleaned? Johnny's show was fresh and original. I'm looking forward to returning in May for another experience that's both new and familiar.

niJ5UYtMhEUkN9L0qNJeGg.text: Bryan was our waiter. Marlon was our cook. Both were excellent. Both very funny very entertaining. I was always told you shouldn't play with your food before you eat it but we made an exception for Marlon. He put on a great show. It was allot of good food for the price. The green tea ice cream at the end was awesome. Met allot of nice people around the  table. I love talking to new people so this was awesome. Definitely recommend! Will be back!
