I did not believe her. Friday night, short staffed?  Newer restaurant but need to get their act together. And we were in the bar..the hostess she wouldn't seat us until we paid our bar tab. But we couldn't settle our bar tab til we had a table....

a3Md4BBHxR1sYhNGuZzDlQ.text: My first time to Benihana's and it was a great experience. We wanted to grab lunch on the way out of town and decided to stop by here....the best choice we could have made. Johnny aka "Magic J" was amazing. Not only did he make a great lunch, but he treated us to a magic show. This guy is the best and suggest you ask for Magic J, you will not be disappointed. I will be returning during future visits.

e5KbG0zHFBs7ExV3jV6K0w.text: Our experience was awesome.  We were entertained, the food was great, and was a great last dinner in Vegas. By far TONY was the best chef of all the Benihana's we have been to. Ee have been to Vegas the last 2 years this is our third. Hopefully a 4th time. If we do we will be going to Benihana's and asking for Tony  ..  Just want to say thank you from Tashia, Betty, Pete, & the Texas Raider fan Juan.

hvRUbPA5Yl8LC1Q1mCVgvA.text: Benihana. Never waivers when it comes to quality!!! Always a great show with a great presentation with an amazing chef. This location has only been open for about 5months, it's a little smaller than what I am familiar with but that's ok, I still enjoy the show around the grill. It's always an amazing place to meet new people. Everyone had a glass of hot green tea, onion soup with mushrooms and little onion as well is a fresh salad with ginger dressing.   My main course, I had grilled shrimp, with fried chicken rice full of garlic butter and when I say full I mean hoooooked up with garlic butter, I also enjoyed teriyaki chicken with a plate full of vegetables. So much food, well seasoned and flavorful, I love Benihana and enjoy the show with every meal. Since it was my birthday, they sang happy birthday and gave me a ice cream Sunday (green tea flavor). I recommend that you join the Benihana's club as I did you will get a meal voucher on your birthday for $30 off you meal. So in the end my meal only came out to $3.00   Great place to take your family for a dinner.

JkEbqEk1t4HY5xNwa3VrAg.text: We always enjoy coming here for birthdays. It has become a tradition now. I'm glad they upgraded their camera they use for events.

FA6vhk4uYYPEcWjiysKpiA.text: 2nd time we dined here. not sure i'll be back. food was ok. lots of oil and VERY salty. servers are ok, but we had to ask for water, refills and more drinks. seemed very busy for our servers.

HnB4aYL8_JDXZW86ccb4-Q.text: Friendly staff, great location, good food.  We chose this location out of location. Parking free at the mall.  Made a reservation an hour advance, got seated. Waiter was very friendly. Our chef was great as well. Overall good. Thanks

jsdzBTJTc3rYs6LXkcpDPQ.text: I usually love this place but I've never visited this specific location. Me and 9 other friends met for dinner and expected the service to be amazing seeing as though we were going to be drinking and eating a lot. Instead we had a rude chef at our table who was visibly frustrated with the orders and how many of us there were. He would ignore us when we would speak to him or try to clarify anything. With such a large group things can get miscommunicated easily between the guest and the server and the chef. Instead of acting professionally and being nice about it he was stand-offish and rude. As a group of black people we definitely felt the stereotype from our server and the management. We purchased a multitude of shots of Don Julio 1942 from the bar because the server was taking extremely long with our drink orders. We still purchased regular drinks as well through the server. By the time we all finished paying we were then chased down by the manager Abby with a reprinted check saying we didn't pay. Of course when I walked in the check with the money in it was sitting clear as day on the table by my plate. Instead of checking the table they assumed we didn't pay and tried to humiliate us in front of the entire restaurant (btw that had 0 other black people there)

cVxQFe67WCu8uSSYjWHT3w.text: Best filet I've ever had at a hibachi restaurant.  Really enjoyed the soup.  The salad dressing was grainy, I didn't care for that.  Hot sake is $12 per carafe so a little overpriced I think.  They cut the shrimp into pieces also, I would rather have it whole.  They only give you zucchini and onions.  Would like broccoli/carrots also?  Rice was amazing and so was the yum yum sauce.  Great service.

0Xl2MbJ9HkccsoR3LEQD9Q.text: We made reservations here for my sisters birthday, the day of and then we happened to be late and they held our reservation for us, which was awesome. This atmosphere had poor selfie lighting and an unbearable amount of heat (I know they cook out in the restaurant but it's the hottest hibachi place I've ever been to). The menu is a little pricey but that's not that surprising. The food was pretty good but the star of the show was the hibachi chef. He was funny , skilled and accommodating and I couldn't ask for anything else from him. I really wish I could attach videos because he was great!

6a2mZQoDUgMCCjwxVJz0Xg.text: We visited here two days in row. Excellent service, friendly staff, and the food was fantastic. We had lunch one day and dinner the nxt. Would return & recommend.

9yqWR2RSMqLPtsbZi421kA.text: I love tepenyaki and was looking forward to coming here but this place was a disaster.  Not one thing went right.  I wish I had taken a picture of my meal. It was literally a pile of onions, and a pile of tofu; that's it, nothing else.  The waitress was rude about doing anything vegetarian for me. I don't eat shrimp so asked for a substitute of vegetables. Nope, sorry can't do it.  Seriously? You just mixed vegetables into everyone else's dishes right in front of me but you can't mix up just vegetables for me? The chef took forever, my food literally was done 30 mins before my husband's way overdone steak. And the worst part was that we came out reeking from the chef using way, way, way too much oil and garlic. We had to bail on our night out and toss our clothes in a plastic bag it was so bad. Two shampoos later, and my hair still smells.

i7MN5wZP5jGt1rOVPh1n7w.text: First time at this establishment and the food was great so was our cook. However, there was no ventilation at all, this place was so hot and stuffy. I had a hard time breathing, which in return I couldn't truly enjoy my meal. Please don't wear a sweater or jacket in this place, you might pass out due to the heat from the skillet and building overall.

hyqkWWPxrMNElWMOJpvMjw.text: One of the girls I was with works at a Benihana in the Bay Area, and since we were in Vegas we decided to check this one out. I haven't been to a Benihana restaurant in years, so I was pretty excited. We had a reservation and got seated pretty fast. Our server was really nice, but a little slow to bring out our drinks (there was not many people in the restaurant at the time), but we didn't really mind. The food was just how I remembered it, SO GOOD! I ordered the shrimp, and it was delicious. Our chef (sadly I forgot his name) was so cool and very efficient! They brought my friend out ice cream for her birthday, but the waiter took awhile to get workers over to sing for her (which was a little odd), by the time they came her ice cream was already half eaten so it didn't melt. The manager came over after the meal and asked how everything was, she was very nice and sincere! Other than a few minor things, was overall a good experience!

GNoPyGej2hlhOwlPzQJJzA.text: Nice atmosphere. More modern than the one near where I live.  Had a good time and everyone was friendly and helpful.

i0W7mLTTs5kAJPzTdCqvjw.text: Omg! This place is great. When I called to ask about happy hour the guy was kinda monotoned. I guess it wasn't that busy. Plus it was raining in Vegas   Lunch menu is awesome! HALF THE PRICE GUYS! Whoop  Kyle our grill chef was great, super funny! Ask for him to be your chef if he's in! The atmosphere was a little quite but it was lunch time. We did get to sit with two other couples and they were great too! The food. Spot on.   My scallops were grilled nicely. super soft and I had enough to share with my mom and brother. We all ordered the chicken fried rice which was $1 extra which isn't bad. The alternative is veggie fried rice.  Mom and brother got the hibachi chicken. It was a little dry for my, but I'm not much of a grilled chicken girl either. My mom and my brother enjoyed it very much.  My salad was good, nothing special. Just iceberg lettuce and some carrots. The dressing was your usual ginger miso.  Soup, i would go with that next time. It had an amazing mushroom broth with just a slice or mushroom and tempura onions! It was delish. Def an UMAMI dish   Looking forward to going to eat here for my sister in laws birthday this week! Gonna try the steak next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Benihana - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My view from the far corner lol excited for all that RICE!

nenrE49aLfv_7L0Tov91OA.text: We had 10pm reservation and finally at 10:40pm we left because they couldn't bother to seat us. What's the point of a reservation if I have to sit around for 40 minutes with no end in sight?

KARyfOv7zuEU5CjL11wYgQ.text: Ok so I have to say that I was really let down my my experience at Benihana.  I had a reservation for 12 people for 6:30pm. We get to the restaurant and are seated. Mind you, I called the day before and made a reservation for 12 people, my guest amount never changed, They sit us in 2 tables of 8. Prior to even choosing Benihana as the restaurant to celebrate my niece's birthday I did my research to make sure that they would be able to accommodate such a large party. On the Benihana page it says that they have 12 seater hibachi tables so the fact that after calling and making a reservation for 12 the day prior they sat us in 2 tables of 8 was ridiculous. I honestly didn't feel like I celebrated my niece's birthday with her because I was seated at a different table. If they didn't have a table to accommodate such a large group they should of told me when I made the reservation. And  No, I wasn't told prior that this would be the situation. We get to the table and I tell her, "there's some chairs missing." And the hostess then said we would be sitting that these two tables.  Usually I would of addressed the situation but I was with my elderly grandmother and hungry children plus we had plans after so I didn't want them to have to wait for us to be accommodated like we were a last minute walk up. So I just bit the bullet on it.   Once we were seated it took and hour and a half for our cook to come out!! And once he came out he had to go back to the kitchen because he didn't have our full order. The cook was great! He did the best he could for the situation. I have no complaints there.   However,    I was disappointed at the fact that his is my first time to Benihana and I didn't enjoy the full dining experience. Since we were separated into 2 tables, the cook only "preformed" at the other table and my sister,nephew,myself and my son were stuck looking at his back the hole time. This could of been avoided if were were sitting at a 12 seater table.   Also, ventilation was horrible. I had to take my nephew's and children outside every once in while because either their eyes were burning or they couldn't breathe.   So I am sad to say that I would not be going back to Benihana.

_c4SrpgN36eoG7aYc7c6gQ.text: I got the Emperors Feast & it was yummy! The steak was way better than the chicken, though. I also ordered a rainbow roll which wasn't that great at all, but my cocktail was good! The onion soup was very good as well. A good birthday lunch! Thank you

d3a9FTa7-sK4G-p9ewk1tw.text: It wasn't horrible but it also wasn't great. We sat with a family that didn't speak at all. No fun.  We sat right by the kitchen area and the waitress kept on having me scoot my chair in so she can fit. I was already about an inch away from the grill just so she can fit.  It sucked as this was interrupting conversations.  They need to move the table so there's enough space especially with the waitress being a bit wide.  Outside of that it would've been ok if you didn't end up smelling like a grease pit afterwards.  We went to a show after dinner and as embarrassing it is to say, we wreaked.  Somehow the smell of old grease was stuck on our hair, clothes including undies.  No exaggeration. It was bad and I have no clue why or how we got impregnated with the aroma from there.  If anyone is reading this and wanna know how to get rid of the smell, here's what we did.  Take a long hot shower.  As far as the clothes, we had to google 'Benihana' and 'smell' and discovered that this isn't uncommon. I'm yet to buy OxiClean to soak our clothes for 4 hours. This is supposedly going to get rid of the smell and it won't resurface.  Now our expectations have been set that if we wanna enjoy Hibachi and decide to go to Benihana that we request for a table that's not by the kitchen and we go in a group of 8 or 9 so we get the table to ourselves.  It should also be timed when it's the only place we're going to or the last place before going home so people we come across or near don't give us stink eye or pinched nose as we walk pass due to the grease pit smell.  We can also prepare for a hot, long shower when we get home and undress in the garage and soak clothes in a bucket of OxiClean.  Otherwise clothes go in the backyard bon fire  and yes, including undies.

y9jyL2d2dk0nO5J0_roCWw.text: My mom took me here today for lunch and we had an awful waitress. The whole experience though was just negative. First off, people were not waiting to be seated and were just taking tables, so we had to wait a bit longer. No big deal. A hostess then tells us which table to sit at and points us to it. My mom and I sit down and order two sushi rolls, two spicy chicken fried rice, and asked for two yum yum sauces. We should of been in and out within 20-30 mins but nope, we were there for over an hour. Our waitress brought us empty soy sauce, then didnt bring us yum yum sauce as we were eating one sushi roll so it ruined our experience since we wanted it for the sushi. Then after 15 minutes of asking for another soy sauce and yum yum sauce we finally get the soy sauce but only one yum yum when we needed two, but now where is our rice and other roll? The place wasn't even busy and we felt ignored. We get our rice, finally another sauce, eat it, but still waiting for the second sushi roll. This is now over 45 minutes of ordering. Our waitress also did not bring us plates or silverware and we had to ask someone else for it. As we were also waiting for the last roll to come she took one of our plates away for no reason. We need that to eat clearly so again we had to ask someone else. We talked to a manager who was great and super kind. He gave us 50% off our bill and we appreciated that a lot, but then our waitreas comes over and tries to argue with us about our order, and accused us of not waiting for a table when we did wait. She was trying to fight with us, so we told her we were done with her and went back to find a manager again. Her communication skills were awful and she does not know how to treat guests or work in a restaurant environment. I won't go back to this location because of her. The food tasted good but she is a horrible server and she is representing a brand. I do not want to eat somewhere with employees like her because she stressed me out. fQTkTg84t1DjgXHYMvEYVg.text: Entertaining, fun for family but they ran out of glasses and my table didn't get our drinks for a while, the food was good and the wait staff was friendly but they mixed up our checks and we had to call the waitress back to give them to the right person

mAAYdavoZzncSG5EdMkTrA.text: The highest quality steak and seafood combined with sushi near Wynn casino and Treasure Island with outdoor seating next to the fashion show shopping mall, how can you get better dining than that on the Strip along Las Vegas Boulevard? As soon as the doors opened, tourists visiting Las Vegas for the NFR 2016 began pouring in after shopping inside the Fashion Mall. The tables were filled around the grills before noon after they only opened at 11 am. The chef and waitresses were friendly, personable, extremely helpful at explaining the menu, which had excellent prices, especially for lunch. The prices were so good that they surprised me, because the interior is fancy, sitting across from the Wynn Casino that you can see looking out the window, my expectations were for a high price menu, but the prices were excellent, and they had a children's menu for my boy: Appetizers, soups, salad, chicken fried rice, and combinations with steak and seafood: Lobster, scallops, shrimp, the chef put on an amazing show with an onion volcano flaming on fire, green onions with various sauces decorating beef steak, calamari; We watched the tables around us as their dishes were prepared with lobster. Plus the menu promoted a sushi boat. Ginger mushroom soup was served. The highlight for visitors is the location with views, especially if you want to stay on the Strip and not leave Las Vegas Boulevard. Enjoy Benihana as your children visit Santa Claus next to the Apple Store inside. Coffee lovers will be pleased, because there is a Starbucks Coffee right next door so you can continue your trip walking down the Las Vegas Strip. Special thanks to the waitress who was so kind, incredibly helpful and very enthusiastic to make sure all the guests had a great time. The guests around us were all visiting for a medical convention and the National Finals Rodeo at the Thomas and Mack Center. Many had tourists questions about Las Vegas. The waitress and chef at Benihana took the time to answer all the tourists' questions. She was wonderful to the customers, especially those who were having a first time experience with the lunch that arrives with a show, a Las Vegas type show inside a quality Japanese restaurant in the Entertainment Capital of the World.

WfN1vXi9fW3Uy425l5wGhg.text: Would highly recommend! Easy to reserve on open table. Alex is a highly attentive waiter and Ryan is a hilarious and talented chef! Food is awesome! I am gluten free and vegan and the staff is very accommodating. Great food, decent price, great entertainment!

1AqF7TXSGb3tHTX6beQn4g.text: Good food. Family friendly environment. I thought I was going to pay a arm and a leg but they have very reasonable pricing. I wish my chef had a little bit more help from the staff, he was waiting around for a few ingredients before someone filing brought him what he needed and we didn't see our server again until after the dinner was over. She only brought us one round of drinks and never came back to check on us. Other than that I will be coming back .

4pMxgZqLiccvPUZHQkj5dA.text: I came here couple days ago with 2 of my buddies and sat on one of their teppan table. I never try benihana before so I thought to give it a shot.  Let's talk about the service. The server came not to long after we sat. She smiled, tell us her name, welcomed us and give us some recommendations for drinks. Her name is vinni. The drinks come pretty fast. We order some food after. I ordered fillet with shrimp. One of my buddies got 12 oz steak and the other one order shrimp and scallop. Vinnie told us that they dont have combination shrimp and scallop only. It has calamari too. But she said she can replace the calamari with extra shrimp instead if it OK with us. The price will be cheaper than a la carte. Will do then. We also order 1 appetizer that she recommended  it's crispy tuna. Very delicious!! Don't missed the fried rice. It's so good!   We got our soup and salad, finish with our 2 rounds drinks also finish our appetizers. Where is the chef? Vinnie told us that the chef will be out soon but he didn't come. She knew that we were waiting. She offered us to order another drink while waiting and we did. Thanks to her that she didn't leave and let us wait with nothing. Excellent service!! A+  Here is the chef finally here. His name is tony. Friendly and nice guy. He started the shows and talked. We waited and waited for the food to be to be done. We were so hungry. Both of my buddies couldnt wait, they went outside and come back 30 minutes later and the food still not ready. Wow!! I wonder how long this dinner will be? He forgot couple things, not professional! Over all,we've waited for more than 1.5 hours to get all our food done to cooked.  The food taste good but the timing is awful. The chef just need to stop talking and cook faster. We had to leave before he finished clean the grill.  Come back? Maybe if I have plenty of time to eat because it will take at least 2 hours for the dinner.

QHALWlJIiYP2jrVpk8Cblg.text: My family and I had a reservation at this establishment this evening at 7:30. We arrived on time, but our other members of our party where 5 minutes behind us. They told us once our entire party was there our table was ready for us. Well when the others arrived 5 minutes later we were still waiting for another 30 minutes to be seated. Once we were walked to our table it was not big enough for our party. We had a party of 8 adults and 2 kids, but they tried to put us into a spot for 8 adults. They told us we had to wait another 30 minutes to wait for a bigger table. So at 8:40 we were seated at a bigger table, but they forgot a seat for 1 more adult that was in the restroom, so we still had to squeeze in. We decide to sit anyways as it was already an hour past our reservation.  Once we were seated, they took our order and we were waiting again. An employee from the front desk asked if we were ok which my mom replied "No, we have been here 2 hours and have not been served, can I see your manager?" Well guess who never came to see us??? The chef finally got to our table at almost 10, he was very friendly, but he over cooked the shrimp appetizer, over cooked 2 filet steaks, and 2 chicken dishes. I was like "Are you kidding me?"  We were never offered an apology for the crappy service that we received. They only comped our side order of shrimp (which is $8). Our bill was over $300, again "Are you kidding me?" We will be contacting corporate, as our chef proudly said they were a corporate Benihana's...I suggest to anyone reading this post that if you want to go to Benihana's in Las Vegas, NV, go to Westgate Hotel. They have a Benihana's there that is so much better then here!!!!
